meanings.definition: (ポルトガル語)自分自身を縛る、束縛する、束縛される
meanings.english_definition: (Portuguese) to tie oneself up; to bind oneself; to become bound or restricted.

examples.sentence: Ele decidiu amarrar-se à árvore para protestar.
examples.translation: He decided to tie himself to the tree to protest.

examples.sentence: Não se amarre a coisas materiais.
examples.translation: Don't become attached to material things.
She became emotionally attached to him.

collocations: amarrar-se emocionalmente (感情的に縛られる)
amarrar-se financeiramente (経済的に縛られる)

usage_notes.explanation: 「amarrar-se」は再帰動詞で、行為の主体が自分自身に影響を与えることを示します。物理的に自分を縛る意味の他に、感情的、経済的に何かに束縛される、依存するという意味合いで使われることが多いです。

examples.note: 「amarrar」を他動詞として使う場合、代名詞の位置に注意。
再帰動詞として使う場合は、必ず「se」を使用し、前置詞は「a」を使う。

derivatives: amarrado (形容詞: 縛られた、けちな)

readability_explanation.text: 「amarrar-se」は、自分自身を物理的に縛るか、感情的または比喩的に何かに束縛されることを意味する動詞です。再帰動詞であるため、「se」という再帰代名詞が使われます。例えば、「Ele amarrou-se à cadeira. (彼は椅子に自分を縛り付けた)」や「Ela amarrou-se às lembranças do passado. (彼女は過去の思い出に縛られた)」のように使われます。比喩的な意味合いで使われることが多いので、文脈に注意して理解しましょう。

example_sentences.sentence: O alpinista teve que amarrar-se à corda de segurança.
example_sentences.translation: The climber had to tie himself to the safety rope.

example_sentences.sentence: Não se amarre a relacionamentos tóxicos.
example_sentences.translation: Don't get attached to toxic relationships.

example_sentences.sentence: Ela se amarrou ao trabalho para esquecer os problemas.
example_sentences.translation: She became engrossed in work to forget her problems.
